result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar Miranda-Sanchez

Defendant in court with Attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Oscar Miranda-Sanchez in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Leave on for trial

INterpreter duly sworn.  ADA Sattler advises that officer is not available and asks for a set over or will dismiss and reissue.  Atty Gonzalez does nto object to set over.   ADA Sattler indicates state is prepared to dismiss & reissue but defense advises they would prefer a set over vs. a dismissal & reissue.  Ct. grants request for set over.

Email from Atty Sattler requesting the jury trial in this matter be rescheduled as one of the necessary witnesses is unavailable; Atty Gonzalez did not object; Court granted request and will reschedule STC/JS/JT

Reporter: Heather Kieta
State requested the Court conduct a Ludwig hearing; State's offer to resolve the matter was a referral to the Deferred Prosecution Program and dismissal of Count 2; Defendant rejected offer; case will be left on trial calendar
Status conference on August 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Atty Sattler requested setover of jury selection/jury trial as she was preparing for three felony trials to be tried on the same date; Atty Gonzalez had no objection to the request; Court granted request and will reschedule STC/JS/JT

Final pre-trial on July 14, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Court adjourned final pretrial hearing; Defendant appeared without counsel and advised he had applied to the State Public Defender's Office and did not qualify; Defendant made application to the Criminal Defense Project and advised he did not qualify for that program either; Court will reschedule FPT/STC/JS/JT and Defendant was advised to obtain counsel before the next hearing
Final pre-trial on June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Yenica R. except electronic communication (email/text) solely for the purpose of arranging child exchange/visitation.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with his children after having consumed any alcohol.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Daniel J.-B.
  - Defendant shall not be at 2202 Rosenberry Rd in Madison, WI.
Trial Judge - Br 5

Defendant appeared.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jim Larson, interpreter, appeared. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  
The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
